posts.author: KailPendragon
posts.content: What's the point of RDD 12 vs Bard 14?

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content: I made this build back in July, so I am not sure why. I guess Bard 14 would bring Bard spells up above what my Charisma would support, and yet wouldn't reach the next level of Bard song, so I opted for 2 levels of D12 hit die.

posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content:
Empyre65 wrote:I made this build back in July, so I am not sure why. I guess Bard 14 would bring Bard spells up above what my Charisma would support, and yet wouldn't reach the next level of Bard song, so I opted for 2 levels of D12 hit die.
So why not increase your charisma? I'm sure another spell level of Bard is much more useful than 12 HP, no?

Another thing I would try to do is squeeze Epic Mage Armor in for another +5 Dodge AC. And you have some conflicting choices there that I don't understand. Why take EDR and Epic Warding? If you go for EDR then take EMA for even more AC and to be harder to hit, or drop those CON increases and be a happy elf that tanks through AC rather than DR. Plus you have UMD, so Premonition is available through scrolls. IMO EDR there is very droppable there in favor of CHA or STR (or both).

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content:
My goal here was to make an Elf with EDR. Dropping EDR would make this a whole other build.

Taking Epic Mage Armor instead of Epic Warding would be no problem.

It would take a lot of shuffling around, but I think I could modify the build to take advantage of 2 more levels of Bard.

posts.author: KailPendragon
posts.content:
Empyre65 wrote:I made this build back in July, so I am not sure why. I guess Bard 14 would bring Bard spells up above what my Charisma would support, and yet wouldn't reach the next level of Bard song, so I opted for 2 levels of D12 hit die.
Bard 14 is a new level of bard song (the previous one is bard 11) granting a further +8 HPs and +1AC.

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content: It looks like this one needs to be rebuilt, too. I am wary of temporary HPs though, because if your health is too low when they go away, you could die.

posts.author: KailPendragon
posts.content:
Empyre65 wrote:It looks like this one needs to be rebuilt, too. I am wary of temporary HPs though, because if your health is too low when they go away, you could die.
No, that does not happen since they are lost first. Con enhancement can make you die when it wears off, not temporary HPs.

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content: Oh. I had been warned against, for example, the Aid spell for that reason.

posts.author: KailPendragon
posts.content:
Empyre65 wrote:Oh. I had been warned against, for example, the Aid spell for that reason.
A false warning since the Aid spell gives temporary HPs. It's temporary Con enhancements to give problems like endurance, con ioun stone and barbarian rage.
